title: Letter: Gates has fallen into the zero emissions trap
text:
Well-meaning Bill Gates falls into the zero emissions trap as the solution for the climate problem (Life & Arts, FT Weekend, February 20). Even if all emissions were zero tomorrow, heating, droughts, floods, storms and rising sea levels will just continue.

The first assignment in climate policy is to do everything that contributes to lowering the concentration of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere: global cooling. That is what trees, forests, mangroves, seagrass lands, oceans and soils do.

Stopping Brazil's president Jair Bolsonaro from destroying the Amazon rainforest should be at the top of the global climate agenda, “whatever it takes”.

Wouter Veening
President, Institute for Environmental Security, The Hague, The Netherlands
